tree.mainmatter: Given a formal topology \mathcal{A} = (S, \sqsubseteq , \lhd ), a subset A \subseteq S is called saturated if it is a fixed point of the closure operator associated with \mathcal{A}, which is to say it satisfies \mathsf{Clos} _{ \mathcal{A} }(A) = A.

mainmatter.p: With any formal topology \mathcal{A} = (S, \sqsubseteq , \lhd ), there is an associated closure operator: \mathsf{Clos} _{ \mathcal{A} }(U) \vcentcolon \equiv \{ a \in S \mid a \lhd U \} .
